ai_analysis.root_cause: Current stock (7 units) is critically below safety stock (25 units) with long lead time (87 days) and medium supplier risk, creating high AOG exposure.

mitigation_options.description: Expedite replenishment via air freight to reduce lead time by 50-70%.
Fast-track certification of pre-vetted North American supplier to diversify sourcing.
Increase safety stock to 35 units with buffer for lead time variability.

ai_analysis.recommended_action: Combine emergency air freight (immediate gap coverage) with alternate supplier qualification (long-term resilience). Safety stock adjustment should follow after lead time reduction.
ai_analysis.expected_roi: $28M saved vs. $750k investment (emergency + qualification costs) = 37:1 ROI

ai_analysis.root_cause: Critical component faces stockout due to negative current inventory (-1 units), insufficient safety stock coverage for 89-day lead time, and medium supplier risk in a single-source region.

mitigation_options.description: Expedite next shipment via air freight with premium logistics
Fast-track certification for European backup supplier with 60-day lead time
Increase safety stock to 45 units (+60%) to cover lead time variability

ai_analysis.recommended_action: Implement Emergency Air Freight Order immediately while initiating Alternate Supplier Qualification for long-term resilience. The $150k expedite cost is 0.5% of AOG exposure risk.
ai_analysis.expected_roi: $30.1M risk mitigation vs $400k total investment (1:75 ROI)

ai_analysis.root_cause: High supplier risk in the Middle East combined with long lead times (88 days) creates vulnerability to supply disruptions, exacerbated by critical part status and high AOG exposure.

mitigation_options.description: Place expedited order to build buffer stock above safety levels
Qualify secondary supplier from lower-risk region
Increase safety stock to 50 units (+66%) to cover extended lead time variability

ai_analysis.recommended_action: Implement Inventory Adjustment immediately while initiating Alternate Supplier Development for long-term resilience. The 7-day implementation provides immediate risk coverage while addressing root cause through supplier diversification.
ai_analysis.expected_roi: $28.3M savings vs. $1.45M total investment (emergency + inventory costs). AOG exposure reduction justifies 19:1 ROI.

ai_analysis.root_cause: High supplier risk in Middle East region combined with long lead times creates supply chain vulnerability, exacerbated by critical part status and high AOG exposure.

mitigation_options.description: Increase safety stock from 30 to 60 units to cover lead time variability
Qualify alternate supplier from stable region (e.g., North America) while maintaining current supplier
Negotiate consignment stock or priority production slot with current supplier

ai_analysis.recommended_action: Implement Dual-Sourcing Strategy with temporary Inventory Buffer Increase during supplier qualification period. This addresses root cause while providing immediate risk reduction.
ai_analysis.expected_roi: Potential $18-25M AOG cost avoidance vs. $3.1M investment (400-700% ROI) within 18 months

ai_analysis.root_cause: High-risk single-source supplier with extended lead time (88 days) in a geopolitically volatile region, creating vulnerability to supply disruptions despite safety stock matching current inventory.

mitigation_options.description: Place expedited order with current supplier using air freight to reduce lead time
Accelerate certification of secondary supplier in stable region (e.g., North America)
Increase inventory buffer by 50% (add 17 units) to cover extended disruption scenarios

ai_analysis.recommended_action: Implement Alternate Supplier Qualification while placing emergency air order as interim solution. Dual-sourcing strategy addresses root cause of single-point failure while maintaining operations.
ai_analysis.expected_roi: $28.2M potential AOG cost avoidance vs $2M investment (14:1 ROI)
